text: what this game need is remake
author: VanCyfox Channel

text: Ótima música, pra sair numa jornada pelos mares azuis!
author: Igo Dreamer

text:
Never played the game before, got a glimpse of it a little but I was probably a little less than 10 years old. I'm 23 now.

But I will never the soundtracks that I deliberately repeated over and over as I played Zelda (because I don't like their 8-bit soundtrack back then lol). I lost the files and back then we didn't have Internet on our computer since it was kind of luxurious. Now that I have fiber optic connection at home, I come back for their songs every now and then.

I love the sound of the fingers against the guitar's nylon, the clear picks of every melody, the chords they used, and the simple melodies that are played on the piano. It's just pure instrumental music.
author: Margareth Su

text: Jeff & PBG sailing together... Good times
author: SamTheMarioMan

text: This game may have been a bit worse than Chrono Trigger, but Cross wins by a long shot in the music department.
author: Bori Konstantinov

text: Best ost ever
author: Diveuz

text: Love both games but actually prefer Cross to Trigger. Minority, I know.
author: xOmniCloudx

text: Yeah they are both great games it is sad that Chrono Cross has always been in Triggers shadow
author: Gaming Powerz

text:
I prefer Cross than Trigger too.
Just one thing that really annoyed me on Chrono Cross is the character design. Many of them are... too funny.
author: Besty TheYellowDuck

text: +xOmniCloudx Agreed, I'm one of the few that likes Cross more than Trigger. As its been said many times before, the hype of Trigger was just too much for Cross to live up to, but by all means, it may not be a great CHRONO game, but it's still one hell of a classic RPG!
author: Waffersforever

text: I played Cross before Trigger. I still prefer this over Trigger
author: Augusto Gonçalves

text:
Fellow Cross fan here. 
I've tried my best to love Trigger. I've played through a lot of it, never finished it. I just grow bored of it and quit.
I am glad I played Cross first.
author: Glenn Griffon

text: How many actually playable characters had Chrono Cross actually ? 30 ? I remember that they are a lot of them, but I think it was more like quantity over quality in character depth and such D:
author: Evilriku13

text: The bass sounds remind me at FFVIII.
author: Nontinteressa Mki

text: This was posted on my birthday and this is one of my favorite tracks from one of my favorite games. Cool beans.
author: SuperJTthunder

text:
Yasunori Mitsuda! I love this man's work!

His masterpiece of a score to Xenogears holds a very special place in my heart. Hell, all his scores do.

: )
author: Jonathan Goldberg

text: chrono soundtrack ftw
author: Zazie900

text: This is my all-time favorite game. However, I can see why it would be a disappointment to Trigger fans as the game definitely has a much different feel from that game.
author: Jon

text: Interesting. FF games are released in sequential order: FF 1, then FF 2 all the way through 14, yet each world is unique and players expect a different experience with each game. Chrono Cross is not a numbered sequel, as in Chrono Trigger 2, yet everyone compares them even though the two are radically different. The battle system, the narrative direction, the ambience, and oh my god, the music! CC may not have the most epic battle music, but this is the most relaxing piece of VGM I've ever heard:)
author: Kurayamino

text: Chrono Cross is far from my favorite game of all time, but it is my favorite soundtrack of all time. I've expressed it to my gamer friends and associates as well, and challenged them to give me a better soundtrack. They've never been able to. Maybe for them some other soundtrack is better, but for me personally, it does not get any better than this. It's so good that I don't know enough words to express how good it is.
author: aryzner

text:
I absolutely have to get around to this series one day.

Classic games are even harder to check off the list than classic books or movies, just because they're all RPGs
author: EresirThe1st

text: Cool sound track, horrid game.
author: kyokushin25mgt

text: I had a good time playing it as a kid, even if I didn't know what was going on most of the time. Kinda don't want to play it again to keep the good memories unchanged.
author: Sephiko

text: I doubt I have listened to any OST more than this one.  As an overall soundtrack, this has got to have the most spirit behind it.  Now, I am biased as Chrono Cross is in my top 3 games of all time, but the music has to be some of the most passionate work for any game.  Even with all the praise it gets, this OST is still underrated.
author: Dudleyville

text: This is one of the OSTs I'd definitely love to listen to in its entirety every now and then. Quite possibly my favorite video game soundtrack :)
author: myohel0

text: Agreed. I can listen to so many tracks form that score over and over again. The battle theme is not my favorite at all, but listening to the score, you can skip that track, and then you have perfection.
author: Wanghis Khan

text: l've never heard of this game, beautiful song though!
author: TigerPrincess

text:
I never understood how a game like this would have near 10/10s rated across the board, yet was absolutely scorned by some fans. But after hearing the theories and proof of its connections to Chrono Trigger, I can now see why.
It's a shame. If Square hadn't given it the Chrono series title and instead something else, this game would most definitely not be so hatefully remembered.
author: Medal Melodies

text: game is solid as fuck. people just expected too much after trigger
author: joey tunafish

text: Well, to be fair, what happened to the main characters of the better game was horrible.
author: Marinanor

text: @Marinanor the term better is subjective.And did you expect them to live forever just because they saved the world?If you think that scene were Luca's house is on fire means they died on a fire they didn't.It is not shown what happens to them on Cross.
author: Daniel Cardoso

text:
i've been listening to this track for 12 YEARS and im still loving it..
best ocean music ever
author: heyjeySigma

text: Probably the best game I was disappointed with. My expectations following the masterpiece that was Chrono Trigger were simply too high and probably clouded my judgement at the time. It's a big reason why I'll have to replay it someday and give it a better chance. I did like the game, just not as much as many. It's funny how such a top notch soundtrack ended up having one of my least favorite battle themes in an RPG.
author: SupraDarky

text: Final Fantasy VII, this is not.
author: electricmastro

text: Uh, it just wasn't fair what happened to the main characters.
author: Marinanor

text: I love the music from this game.  Mitsuda did an amazing job with the soundtrack for this game.  I'm still waiting for a few songs to be uploaded to this list, but I know it will be a matter of time before you upload them.
author: Eric C.

text: I always feel sorry for devs who have a hard act to follow
author: EresirThe1st

text: @electricmastro You're right. Chrono Cross is a better game and has a better soundtrack than Final Fantasy VII.
author: drunyon214

text: @electricmastro FF7 wish it has an OST as good as this game did. Years later, and i still don't understand all the hype behind FF7, and ive played all FFs  besides 1-3...
author: allthatishere

text: I'm surprised. I love the battle theme for this game because it takes such a weird ensemble of instruments into action. You have a crazy violin with bass and an offset drum with a electric piano going crazy. Really gives the feel that fighting is hectic and a huge contrast from the exploration music the world gives.
author: Alex Batista

text:
@allthatishere
3 is worth a play — The updated version at least.
author: Dessa

text: @Dessa will do. Ive been eyeing it in the psn for awhile now, along with 1 and 2.
author: allthatishere

text: This soundtrack is one of the strongest I think I've ever heard from a videogame, but I do agree. It wasn't the game I expected or quite wanted. Good, but not so amazing as some think. (At least in my book.)
author: Austin L

text: @drunyon214 I have to respectfully disagree with the fact that this game has a better soundtrack than FF VII.  I will give that the sound quality for this soundtrack is much better, but I honestly think that this soundtrack is too light-hearted in some places.  Plus, Mitsuda was still developing his sound since his first big gig as a composer came 5 years prior to making this soundtrack.  Still a good soundtrack though.
author: Eric C.

text: @Eric C. this is leagues above ff7 lol.
author: omensoffate
drunyon214

text:
@*****
One thing Uematsu unquestionably beats Mitsuda on is his fight music.  Mitsuda is amazing, but he's hit or miss with battle tunes.
author: Dessa

text: @***** You may not like Gale (the normal battle theme), but you have to admit that the other four battle themes (Between Life and Death, Prisoner of Fate, Fate - The God of Destiny, and Dragon God) are fantastic, right?
author: drunyon214

text: @***** I'm sure  some people didn't like it. That doesn't mean it's going to be changed tho. And why would that have been the case anyways? Just because you complain about something, doesn't mean its going to be changed. Look at all the people that complained about the FF13 series.
author: allthatishere

text: I didn't mind the normal battle theme. It wasn't a tune I loved or would listen to apart from the game, unlike almost every other theme in the game... so yeah, by that reasoning, it's arguably the worst song in the game. But I didn't dislike it either; the battle theme never bothered me.
author: drunyon214

text: @*****  Wow, you didn't play a game because of one song? Thats a first for me see someone say. Thats almost as shallow as the, "This game has bad graphics so it sucks" argument i see so common nowadays.
author: allthatishere

text: @drunyon214 Yeah. It may have been a good song, but it wasn't a good Chrono Cross song, which can actually sum up my thoughts about entire games (Breath of Fire: Dragon Quarter, for example).
author: Sam Saylor

text: +SupraDarky If only they hadn't ditched the ATB system that square had perfected so well, the game would have been a lot easier to get through. Oh and changing the regular exp system for some bullshit leveling up system did not help either. To make matters worse they had this trend since Xenogears and continued with in future games. Why fix what isn't broken? why do the japanese hate the ATB system, why?
author: Lion heart

text: +allthatishere while the remake is more approachable and they did a good job with the soundtrack, i felt the 3d graphics were muddy and didn't do the game justice. I think really good 8bit graphics are better than meh 3D. If you can stomach it, i recommend playing the original one day.
author: ragnaroktomorrow

text: I think I had the benefit of only KNOWING CT when I played CC. I went back and played it on PS1 in a collection with FFVI I purchased one year. I agree that it's one of the worst battle themes. Not because the instrumentation, I just it's all over the place, and It's a song that you do have to hear a LOT. I do not think it would've been as jarring had it been a once in a while fight theme/specific boss battle, or something like that. Aside form that battle theme, I think CC has one of the best soundtracks of all time. I come back to it time and time again. The other tracks are just that good. Especially when paired with some of the great locations that exist in that game.
author: Wanghis Khan
